author: sfgate.com
title: Daily Briefing, Sept. 30
text:
Getting it together 
Box CEO Aaron Levie kicked off BoxWorks 2015 with a fireside chat, left, with Apple CEO Tim Cook. In the talk, Cook said that in the past year, Apple has generated $25 billion in enterprise business. “This is not a hobby,” Cook said. The conference runs through Wednesday. 
Tweet of the day 
“Can you hear me now?” 
That was former CIA employee and government contractor Edward Snowden, who leaked classified information from the NSA in 2013. He joined Twitter Tuesday morning and by midday had 495,000 followers. 
Rumor has it 
Twitter will soon allow users to create tweets longer than the company’s signature 140-character limit, says tech website Recode, citing sources familiar with the company’s plans. Interim CEO Jack Dorsey recently reopened the discussion about the character limit, as he explores new ways to grow the company’s user base.
The Daily Briefing is compiled from San Francisco Chronicle staff and news services. See more items and links at www.sfgate.com . Twitter: @techchronicle
